hero.question: Will US or Israel strike Iran first?
hero.prob_take: The 6.5-point drop signals sellers are pricing in lower military appetite after weekend diplomatic chatter and internal US debate over escalation costs, though the volume remains modest enough that a single news event could swing it back. At 56.5%, you're getting decent value on a strike happening within the market window, regional temperature is still hot, and one Iranian provocation or Israeli intelligence claim flips this faster than you can refresh the feed.

daily_take.headline: Iran Strike Odds Collapse 6.5 Points. Smart Money Sees De-escalation.
daily_take.deck: US-Israel strike odds dropped from 63% to 56.5% in 24 hours on $296K volume, signaling a real shift in positioning rather than noise. The market sniffed out either diplomatic backchanneling or political hesitation from either side. Smart bettors should fade the panic sellers here: a 56.5% price on binary geopolitical risk this volatile is undervalued given the upstream catalysts still in play over the next 60 days.
